part.Name: Description
part.Short: Erosion's gritted fingers have worked the likeness off recrystallized dolomite. A sand-smoothed suggestion of shape lingers still -- diacalyptus columns bearing the proud weight of vast shoulders, and a memory of snout jutting below a faded face. Verdure selfishly reclaims polished spaces and crawls in bryophite clumps, draping the nondescript subject in regal viridian.

part.Name: RulesDescription
part.Text:
This object is a monument to a scene from the history of {{M|Shikspar}}.
In 857, Bubumube decided to quit traveling Qud. They left Ezra and settled with their followers beyond the southern jungles. There, they named the village Shikspar, and sowed starapple seeds in the furrowed dirt.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Chrome meshs form successive horizons upon which dairy blossoms and crust colonizes.
